item.title: NPC's continue to talk. [NOT RESOLVED YET]
item.dc:creator: @ztornado5 ztornado5
item.description:
@ztornado5 wrote:

Okay, I figured the easiest way to show you this is by showing you a part of my client.java.
This is on a delta based server by the way.

case 116: talk("Would you like to go to Barrows mate?", 2024); break; case 117: choice("Yes.", "No."); break; case 118: talk("'Ello, and what are you after then?", 1597); break; case 119: talk("I have a wide selection of Slayer equipment; take a look!", 1597); break; case 120: talk2("You're only assigned to kill", ""+GetNpcName(taskID)+"; only "+taskAmount+" more to go.", 1597); break; case 121: talk("My name's Vannaka; I'm a Slayer Master.", 1597); break; case 122: talk2("You'll find me in Edgeville. I'll be here when you need", "a new task.", 1597); break; case 123: talk2("You do not have a task.", "Talk to me in Edgeville when you get one.", 1597); break;

So, after talking to Strange old man, it automatically goes to vannaka without letting you select an option.
I created a backup of my files, but it is from quite a long time ago. If I can just find the part of client.java (or other file)
that I need to fix this problem, I’ll be all set. So, my question is this: What part of client.java (or other file) controls this?

Read full topic
